availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander Hueston Rennick (Franklin County court clerk)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, court clerk. Mercer County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Rennick and Mary Hueston Rennick. Married Letitia Lee Rennick in 1817. Father of Mary Rennick Todd, Eliza Rennick, Catherine Rennick Mongtomery, Alisonia Rennick Todd, Louisa Rennick Milton, Willis Lee Rennick, John Alexander Rennick, Thomas Todd Rennick, Henry Swigert Rennick. War of 1812 veteran. Franklin County Court Deputy Clerk for Willis Lee from 1817 to 1834. Franklin County Court Clerk from 1834 to 1870.

bibl.p: “The Rennicks,” Register of Kentucky State Historical Society 2 (January 1904): p. 71-72; Jordan Dodd, compl., Kentucky Marriages, 1802-1850, Ancestry, Franklin County, 1817; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, District 1, p. 76; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 9; Find A Grave, "Col Alexander Hueston Rennick (1791-1871)," Memorial #84171652, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=84171652 (accessed March 27, 2017).
